pageTitle: Women's Barbour Vintage Quilted Jacket | JULES B
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {213498=Stemar, 155262=A renowned British label with local heritage, the Barbour story originates in 1894 in South Shields when John Barbour started out as a travelling draper supplying oilskins for seafarers and outdoor workmen. Over time, Barbour has grown to be a household name for wax jackets and in turn, their style has evolved to become legendary for functional and timeless fashion. While Barbour continues to be renowned for jackets and overcoats, they have now developed as a standalone lifestyle brand.  No longer appealing solely to country sports fans, they encompass menswear, womenswear, childrenswear, accessories, footwear and more.  Always keeping styles current, the brand often include designer collaborations and iconic influences with a modern edge. The most prestigious of their collections is the Barbour International collection - including capsule ranges including Barbour Steve McQueen™ - influenced by the ‘King of Cool’s’ style and how he pioneered the Barbour International jacket. Whilst the Barbour Black Streak range incorporates women's Barbour jackets and clothing with a rebellious biker-chick inspiration. Barbour, now over a century old, has never compromised their close family values and remains a core British brand. They are still creating designer clothing of great quality, functionality and attention to detail whilst now including the modern fashion edge we all know and love., 181232=International Customer Services Telephone: +44 (0)191 211 2330, 217268=UK Customers: 0845 835 2900, 181179=0845 835 2900, 202844=Cerruti 1881, 169973=Customer Services Email: customercare@julesb.co.uk UK Customer Services Telephone: 0845 835 2900 International Customer Services Telephone: +44 (0)191 211 2330, 217319=International Customers: + (0)44 191 121 2330}
textBeforeTable: Men's size guide Regular: Offering plenty of room for ease-of-wear, the regular fit offers versatility for either city or country dressing Slim: Designed to flatter and offer a contemporary silhouette, the slim fit is Barbour's most streamlined Relaxed: Allowing for under layers, the relaxed fit is Barbour's most generous Barbour jacket fit Please use the chart below to convert between standard size formats Size Conversion Chart Browse and buy Barbour clothing online at Jules B today... A renowned British label with local heritage, the Barbour story originates in 1894 in South Shields when John Barbour started out as a travelling draper supplying oilskins for seafarers and outdoor workmen. Over time, Barbour has grown to be a household name for wax jackets and in turn, their style has evolved to become legendary for functional and timeless fashion. While Barbour continues to be renowned for jackets and overcoats, they have now developed as a standalone lifestyle brand.  No longer appealing solely to country sports fans, they encompass menswear, womenswear, childrenswear, accessories, footwear and more.  Always keeping styles current, the brand often include designer collaborations and iconic influences with a modern edge.
